title: E2E Test: SDK Loop Validation
description: Test epic to validate the super-ralph OpenCode SDK execution loop end-to-end. Contains small, self-contained tasks that exercise the full pipeline: prompt rendering, agent execution, task_complete tool calls, bead closure, and progress tracking.

title: US-001: Add quality gate commands to .super-ralph/AGENTS.md
description:
## Description

The quality gates section in .super-ralph/AGENTS.md currently has placeholder commands (commented out). Since this project now has a TypeScript codebase with `bun run typecheck` as the primary quality gate, update the quality gates section to include the actual command.

## Acceptance Criteria

1. Replace the commented-out placeholder commands in the Quality Gates section of `.super-ralph/AGENTS.md` with the actual project commands:
   - Typecheck: `bun run typecheck`
2. Keep the existing structure and explanatory text
3. Apply the same change to `templates/agents.md` (the template copy) so future projects get the correct defaults

## Quality Gates
- `bun run typecheck` must pass

title: US-002: Add .gitignore entries for beads database
description:
## Description

The .beads/ directory contains a SQLite database (beads.db) that should not be tracked by git — only the JSONL file matters. Add appropriate .gitignore entries.

## Acceptance Criteria

1. Verify the existing .beads/.gitignore handles the database file correctly
2. If not, update it to ignore beads.db and any WAL/SHM files (beads.db-wal, beads.db-shm)
3. The issues.jsonl, config.yaml, and metadata.json files MUST remain tracked
4. Verify with `git status` that no database files show as untracked

## Quality Gates
- `bun run typecheck` must pass
- `git status` shows clean state after changes

title: REVIEW-001: Verify SDK loop migration completeness
description:
## Description

Review the entire super-ralph codebase for any remaining stale references from the SDK loop migration. This is a fresh-eyes review — check everything systematically.

## Acceptance Criteria

1. Search ALL files (not just skills/) for any remaining references to:
   - `ralph-tui` (the old execution tool) — should only appear in archived skills, old design docs, and git history
   - `bd ` (the old Go beads CLI) — should only appear in archived skills
   - `.ralph-tui/` (the old config directory) — should not appear in any active file
   - `<promise>COMPLETE</promise>` (the old completion signal) — should be completely gone
2. Document any findings in .super-ralph/progress.md
3. If stale references are found in active files, fix them
4. Run `bun run typecheck` to ensure no TypeScript issues

## Quality Gates
- `bun run typecheck` must pass
- `grep -rn 'ralph-tui' commands/ skills/ src/ templates/ .super-ralph/ .opencode/ README.md` returns 0 results (excluding _archived/)
